dc:title: On Pilgrimage - February 1960
dc:author: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Shares reactions to an article by Thomas Merton and a biography of Charles de Foucauld. Notes we have hardly begun to understand the gospels. Tells stories of feeling fear and the senseless cold war. Tells of the work of religious and lay groups in Minnesota. Says "we need to pray for vocations, all kinds of vocations."
